alert.note: Alert for Ascension; Assumption; Livingston; Northwest St. Tammany; Southern Tangipahoa; St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Upper Lafourche; Upper Terrebonne (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 30 at 6:29PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of St. John The Baptist, southeastern Ascension, St. James, northwestern St. Charles, west central St. Tammany, north central Terrebonne, southeastern Livingston, northwestern Lafourche, southern Tangipahoa and eastern Assumption Parishes through 700 PM CDT... At 629 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Whitehall to Bayou Geneve. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Thibodaux, Covington, Napoleonville, Reserve, Hahnville, Laplace, Gramercy, Lutcher, Madisonville, Schriever, Montz, Garyville, Supreme, Raceland, Chackbay, Destrehan, Whitehall, Killona, Norco and Paradis. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 184 and 219. Interstate 12 between mile markers 61 and 69. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 24. Interstate 310 between mile markers 6 and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for southeastern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Ascension; Assumption; Livingston; Northwest St. Tammany; Southern Tangipahoa; St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Upper Lafourche; Upper Terrebonne
